New Records: India claimed their second T20 World Cup, 17 years after winning their first
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 76 runs off 59 balls
Heinrich Klaasen produced his best innings of the tournament with 52 off 27 balls
Jasprit Bumrah conceded only six runs in the 16th and 18th overs
Suryakumar Yadav took an outstanding catch to dismiss David Miller
Hardik Pandya picked up Kagiso Rabada and only conceded eight runs in the final over
Post-Match Reflections: Aiden Markram said the team was 'gutted' and that it would take some time to reflect on a'really good campaign'
Virat Kohli said it was his last T20 World Cup and that he was proud to have achieved what they wanted
Jasprit Bumrah said he was 'over the moon' and that it was a great feeling to have won the championship
Miscellaneous Highlights: India posted 176 runs for the loss of eight wickets, the highest-ever innings score in a T20 World Cup final
South Africa looked in early trouble when Reeza Hendricks was cleaned up by Bumrah in the second over
Tristan Stubbs and De Kock rebuilt well to keep the fight going, taking South Africa to 70 in the ninth over
Others: The match was played on June 29, 2024, at Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados
The Proteas required 30 runs from 30 balls with Klaasen and Miller at the crease but were unable to achieve it
